subject: Re: Prolegomena for a new QS font. And here it is.
msgSnippet: I think the font looks rather nice.  I m not well acquainted with Quikscript, so I had a hard time reading it at first.  I examined the letters I recognized,
messageBody:
I think the font looks rather nice. I'm not well acquainted with
Quikscript, so I had a hard time reading it at first. I examined
the letters I recognized, seeming to always be adjacent ones I
didn't. So, I sat and examined it, and then BOOM! I got it. Maybe
I'm just slow. ^_^;
Anyway, my only issues with the font are a few serifs where you
don't really need them. Specifically, the top of /j/ and /v/, and
on the bottom of /b/, /m/, and /f/. I don't think I missed any.
The short ascenders and decenders give it the squatty, geometric
feel of Century Schoolbook, as intended. It certainly brings back
fond memories of strange men named Dick running without good
reason. Dogs, too.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "mcbroom1946"
<mcbroom1946@y...> wrote:
>
> Thanks to all who sent their feedback on my font effort of last
> month. Excuse me for not responding to you all individually.
>
> I don't know where else on the planet I could have turned for such
> valuable comments and gentlemanly criticism.
>
> I have corrected my numerous misspellings, and tweaked many letters
> based on your collective comments. I also made one letter change
which no
> one suggested: "Owe", which looked exactly like an "O," clearly
violated
> Shaw's dictum that no characters should be mistaken for Roman
characters.
> Now it looks more like Read's original.
>
> I have replaced the original sampler "Fish Story" piece in the
files
> section with a revised version, and posted True Type fonts for PC
and Mac in
> the fonts file.
>
> Let me know if you have any trouble using them.
>
> hAppI kwikskriptiN!

I think the font looks rather nice.  I'm not well acquainted with 
Quikscript, so I had a hard time reading it at first.  I examined 
the letters I recognized, seeming to always be adjacent ones I 
didn't.  So, I sat and examined it, and then BOOM! I got it.  Maybe 
I'm just slow. ^_^;
Anyway, my only issues with the font are a few serifs where you 
don't really need them.  Specifically, the top of /j/ and /v/, and 
on the bottom of /b/, /m/, and /f/.  I don't think I missed any.
The short ascenders and decenders give it the squatty, geometric 
feel of Century Schoolbook, as intended.  It certainly brings back 
fond memories of strange men named Dick running without good 
reason.  Dogs, too.
